intro: Spiesia lapponica, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils. It is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh environmental conditions. Spiesia lapponica plays a role in stabilizing soil in alpine and tundra ecosystems.
